Class Precess

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • Precess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ToolkitConstants, java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class Precess
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
implements ToolkitConstants
    Provide GUI support for the Precess (Coordinate Conversion and Precession) program.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void init(javax.servlet.ServletConfig config)
          throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Handle the INIT operation. This operation is invoked by the servlet engine when it starts up. Set the tookit properties if they have not already been set. This includes the proposal data path.
        Specified by:
        init in interface javax.servlet.Servlet

      • service

        public void service(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
             throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Handle a submission from a browser. Five operations are provided:
        1. CLEAR - reset the session variables to their default state.
        2. CALCULATE - check for input errors and execute the command line tool.
        3. VIEW OUTPUT - display the output from the command line tool.
        4. HELP - display the generic toolkit help file.
        5. NAMERESOLVER - use NED/SIMBAD to retrieve coordinates
        Overrides:
        service in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        request - The request object as passed in by the browser.
        response - The response object that will be passed back to the browser.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException

      • executeConversion

        private java.lang.String executeConversion(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                                           java.lang.String inputFormat,
                                           java.lang.String outputFormat,
                                           java.lang.String inputSystem,
                                           java.lang.String outputSystem,
                                           java.lang.String inputPosition1,
                                           java.lang.String inputPosition2)
        Execute a conversion sub-command accumulating the input.
        Parameters:
        out - The output stream providing input to the precess executable.
        inputFormat - The sexigesimal ( hour/minute/second) or decimal degree specifier.
        outputFormat - The sexigesimal ( hour/minute/second) or decimal degree specifier.
        inputSystem - The input coordinate system. Usually the input equinox specification.
        outputSystem - The output coordinate system. Usually the output equinox specification.
        inputPosition1 - The right ascension position.
        inputPosition2 - The declination position.
        Returns:
        The accumulated sub-command input.

      • getInputFormat

        private java.lang.String getInputFormat(java.lang.String position)
        Parse the input to determine whether it is in decimal degrees or HMS format.
        Parameters:
        position - input coordinates
        Returns:
        string ra/dec format used

      • getMatch

        private java.util.regex.Matcher getMatch(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                         int formatCode,
                                         int coordSystemCode,
                                         java.lang.String buffer)
        Do a regular expression match returning the result.
        Parameters:
        request - http servlet request
        session - the session
        formatCode - A code specifying a match using either a decimal or sexagesimal regular expression.
        coordSystemCode - A code specifying which coordinate system; either Equatorial, Ecliptic or Galactic.
        buffer - The string against which the match occurs.
        Returns:
        A regular expession containing extractable elements or null if no matches occurred.

      • initializeInputValues

        private void initializeInputValues(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                   boolean clear)
        Initialize input parameters. Each parameter is processed as follows: 1) The clear flag is false: if the parameter has been passed in this request packet, then the value is stored in the session (cookie). If the parameter is not passed and a session value exists, then nothing is done with the value. If no value exists for the session value, then it is set to the default value. 2) The clear flag is true: the session value is set to the default.
        Parameters:
        request - The servlet request.
        clear - If set use the default value.

      • initializeOutputValues

        private void initializeOutputValues(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                    boolean clear)
        Initialize output parameters. Each parameter is processed as follows: 1) The clear flag is false: if the parameter has been passed in this request packet, then the value is stored in the session (cookie). If the parameter is not passed and a session value exists, then nothing is done with the value. If no value exists for the session value, then it is set to the default value. 2) The clear flag is true: the session value is set to the default.
        Parameters:
        request - The servlet request.
        clear - If set use the default value.
